Wisdom: إِنَّ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ فَرَضَ فِي أَمْوَالِ الْأَغْنِيَاءِ أَقْوَاتَ الْفُقَرَاءِ فَمَا جَاعَ فَقِيرٌ إِلَّا بِمَا مَنَعَ غَنِيٌّ وَاللَّهُ سَائِلُهُمْ عَنْ ذَلِكَ
enWisdom: Verily Allah, the Glorified, has ordained the provisions of the poor in the wealth of the rich, so no poor person goes hungry but because of the withholding of the rich, and Allah will question them about this

Wisdom: الْعَجْزُ مَعَ لُزُومِ الْخَيْرِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ الْقُدْرَةِ مَعَ رُكُوبِ الشَّرِّ [الشُّرُورِ]
enWisdom: Inability accompanied by espousing goodness is better than power accompanied by embarking on evil

Wisdom: خَيْرُ النَّاسِ مَنْ تَحَمَّلَ مَئُونَةَ النَّاسِ
enWisdom: The best person is he who bears the responsibility of providing for the people
Turning away the needy is the cause of diminishment of affluence

Wisdom: قِوَامُ الدُّنْيَا بِأَرْبَعٍ عَالِمٌ يَعْمَلُ بِعِلْمِهِ وَجَاهِلٌ يَسْتَنْكِفُ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ وَغَنِيٌّ يَجُودُ بِمَالِهِ عَلَى الْفُقَرَاءِ وَفَقِيرٌ لَا يَبِيعُ آخِرَتَهُ بِدُنْيَاهُ فَإِذَا لَمْ يَعْمَلِ الْعَالِمُ بِعِلْمِهِ اسْتَنْكَفَ الْجَاهِلُ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ وَإِذَا بَخِلَ الْغَنِيُّ بِمَالِهِ بَاعَ الْفَقِيرُ آخِرَتَهُ بِدُنْيَاهُ
enWisdom: The mainstay of this world is by four [groups]: A scholar who acts on his knowledge, an ignorant person who is not too proud to learn, a wealthy person who is generous with his wealth to the needy and a poor person who does not sell his Hereafter for his worldly lifeSo when the scholar does not act on his knowledge, the ignorant one refuses to learn; and when the wealthy is miserly with his wealth, the poor one sells his Hereafter for his world

Wisdom: مَنْ جَمَعَ الْمَالَ لِيَنْفَعَ [لِيَنْتَفِعَ‏] بِهِ النَّاسُ أَطَاعُوهُ وَمَنْ جَمَعَ لِنَفْسِهِ أَضَاعُوهُ
enWisdom: One who accumulates wealth so that he can benefit people [with it] is obeyed by them and one who accumulates [it] for himself is disregarded by them

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَتْ نِعَمُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ كَثُرَتْ حَوَائِجُ النَّاسِ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: The one upon whom the blessings of Allah are abundant, the people’s needs towards him also abound

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَتْ نِعَمُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ كَثُرَتْ حَوَائِجُ النَّاسِ إِلَيْهِ فَإِنْ قَامَ فِيهَا بِمَا أَوْجَبَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَلَيْهِ فَقَدْ عَرَضَهَا [أَهَّلَهَا] لِلدَّوَامِ وَإِنْ مَنَعَ مَا أَوْجَبَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ فِيهَا فَقَدْ عَرَضَهَا لِلزَّوَالِ
enWisdom: The one upon whom the blessings of Allah are abundant, the people’s needs towards him also abound (so if he fulfils with it what Allah, the Glorified, has made obligatory for him, then he makes it last, and if he refuses what Allah, the Glorified, has made obligatory from it, then he has exposed it to cessation)

Wisdom: مَنْ حَرَمَ السَّائِلَ مَعَ الْقُدْرَةِ عُوقِبَ بِالْحِرْمَانِ
مَنْ لَمْ يَحْتَمِلْ مَئُونَةَ النَّاسِ فَقَدْ أَهَّلَ قُدْرَتَهُ لِانْتِقَالِهَا
enWisdom: One who does not bear the burden of providing for the people has prepared his power for its transference

Wisdom: مِنَ الْوَاجِبِ عَلَى الْغَنِيِّ أَنْ لَا يَضَنَّ عَلَى الْفَقِيرِ بِمَالِهِ
enWisdom: It is obligatory upon the rich person not to withhold his wealth from the poor

Wisdom: وَقُودُ النَّارِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ كُلُّ غَنِيٍّ بَخِلَ بِمَالِهِ عَلَى الْفُقَرَاءِ وَكُلُّ عَالِمٍ بَاعَ الدِّينَ بِالدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: The fuel of hellfire on the Day of Judgment will comprise of every rich person who was miserly towards the poor with his wealth and every learned scholar who sold his Hereafter for the world

Wisdom: لَا تَرُدَّ السَّائِلَ وَصُنْ مُرُوَّتَكَ عَنْ حِرْمَانِهِ
enWisdom: Do not turn away the beggar and safeguard your magnanimity by not depriving him

Wisdom: لَا وِزْرَ أَعْظَمُ مِنْ وِزْرِ غَنِيٍّ مَنَعَ الْمُحْتَاجَ
enWisdom: There is no offence greater than the offence of the rich who deprives the needy

Wisdom: النَّاسُ رَجُلَانِ جَوَادٌ لَا يَجِدُ وَوَاجِدٌ لَا يُسْعِفُ
enWisdom: People are of two types: the generous one who does not possess [anything to bestow] and the one who possesses [plenty] but does not help others [with it]
